website_summaries.verdict: A top-of-the-line multimeter for DIY applications, it's also capable of handling most pro-level electric testing needs. Competitors can't beat its safety, accuracy, and intuitiveness.
pros: accurately measures continuity, resistance, capacitance, frequency, and more
Has a solid build, large back-lit screen, and excellent safety rating (CAT III, 60V)
cons: A few reports of missing parts upon arrival and of faulty/missing leads

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Very solid and well built -Selector and buttons feel really good -Fast and accurate Cons: -S**tty display -Washed out at many angles This is definitely a solid multi-meter. Everything feels good in the hand and seems like it will last forever. The only downside is the display. It's significantly worse than a free Harbor Freight multi-meter. The viewing angles are terrible, even more so with the back light. Not sure if all of them are like this or is it just a couple but do be aware of this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Zhang

customer_reviews.title: For professionals, enthusiasts, and the average joe around the house
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 115 for home use but I can attest it is perfect for any troubleshooting situation. I'm an electrician and I've worked on diesel-electric locomotives which have a dizzying combination of AC/DC as well as hydro-electric generation which is mostly AC. I've used several different Fluke's in my career and in my humble opinion I could have used this 115 in any of the situations I found myself in. It's rugged yet small and portable. I've used this particular Fluke to troubleshoot power issues in my home, to install fans, outlets, and upgrade a breaker box in my buddy's house. As with all Flukes, it's compatible with every upgrade on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J. McKenzieTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great meter, but no repair when it breaks
customer_reviews.text: I love this meter. It has served me well for about 6 years of (very light) use. However, unfortunately the rotary knob started giving me trouble -- when I select VDC the meter does not always register this mode unless I wiggle the dial. I called Fluke to ask for a repair estimate and they told me that this unit is over 3 years old and thus not available for repair. They offered me a slight discount on a new purchase but this is only $15 less than the retail price. I love this meter but it is very disappointing that Fluke does not stand by the this product and will not offer a repair service.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: great for the money
customer_reviews.text: great for the money. the only thing I don't like is that you have to press the hold button to hold the current reading, where as on the fluke 73 which I'm used to using you press the hold button and then when you go and probe your wires or connector or whatever it will make a beep and hold the reading as soon as you get one. this is kind of a big deal for me as an automotive technician since what I'm measuring isn't usually right in front of me and its difficult to always see the screen while I'm contorted and upside down and crammed into some tiny space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My old, trusty DMM crapped out on me so ...
customer_reviews.text: My old, trusty DMM crapped out on me so I decided to get the Fluke 115 to replace it. I used my old DMM for 20+ years as an hobbyist and DIY type of person for diagnosing and installing electrical in vehicles and also for home wiring projects. We have a Class A motorhome and anyone who owns one know how complicated they are with multiple 12VDC and 120VAC electrical systems. I NEVER leave for a trip without packing a DMM. The 115 may have more features than what most hobbyists need, but I'd rather have more and not need them on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: CarlV

customer_reviews.title: Great meter for bungling & confident amateurs like me.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not an engineer or physicist by any means, needed something to identify a faulty microswitch in a failed microwave. From reviews I narrowed down on Fluke over other brands quickly, though had difficulty choosing the right one for my needs. So took a while to figure this would do the job and I could grow into it's other functions. I nailed the rogue switch quickly with the audible continuity function. Comes with a thick instruction manual that is a mini tutorial in electronics. The meter itself is in a removable yellow rubber case that I expect is one reason Fluke has a reputation for durability.
customer_reviews.author: DB Cooper

customer_reviews.title: ... on of these cheaper Fluke meters as I don't like my more expensive ones being abused on the road
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try on of these cheaper Fluke meters as I don't like my more expensive ones being abused on the road. This one covers almost everything I do on a daily basis so the expensive ones only come out when required. Big and high contrasting display is easily readable, the back light is a nice touch. Included leads are Fluke quality as expected. Great little metter
customer_reviews.author: JAAS666

customer_reviews.title: Good Value for Money and Perfectly Compatible with Accessory Clamp
customer_reviews.text: We have dozens of Fluke instruments at work so when I decided to have a Fluke branded DMM for my own use, I decided to buy this little 115. It's lightweight and a joy to use. Made in Singapore. Test leads were not as flexible as I would wish but they're still functional and carry safety ratings. The LCD is fine, just get the view angle right. It pairs well with an accessory clamp (i400e). MIN-MAX function worked great for catching inrush currents. In the 3rd photo, this was measured and compared with a Hioki clamp meter's inrush function. The values were similar.
customer_reviews.author: hobbyist-2006

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for money
customer_reviews.text: This Fluke 115 is an entry level model with an ammeter (the 105 has no ammeter). Build quality is good, and the price is reasonable. You can buy a no name Chinese DMM for $15 but it won't have that Fluke name on it. When I was much younger I wanted a Fluke DMM but could not afford one - today, a Made in the USA Fluke is still $500+ and I don't want to buy one just for sentimentality. So this solid, middle-class China made Fluke is a good substitute.
customer_reviews.author: Orlando A. Andico

customer_reviews.title: Great DMM for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome price, tool truck guy wanted twice the Amazon price for the same meter. Use in an automotive setting. Large, clear display, reads under 10mA which my boss's old Fluke 88 cannot do. Does everything I need for basic automotive repair at a great price. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Apple533d

customer_reviews.title: This rendered the unit useless for measuring amperage until I purchased and installed a ...
customer_reviews.text: My Fluke 115 came without the fuse: where it is supposed to be located there was nothing, empty space. This rendered the unit useless for measuring amperage until I purchased and installed a spare fuse ($8 on amazon). I was not expecting a quality assurance problem of this magnitude in such an expensive unit.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Villaveces

customer_reviews.title: Good Meter but ensure you complement with other test equipment for additional verification
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help test components eg diodes, transistors (NPN/PNP) and finally.. capacitors, all worked pretty much except for caps it will give you the values correctly but the final test should be with an ESR meter as the fluke provided accurate capacitance but he ESR meter diagnosed a defective component that other wise you would have thought was good
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Comes with leads, but buy a protective case. It'll outlive us if cared for
customer_reviews.text: I've used the Fluke 115 in avionics troubleshooting, automotive/motorcycle, household electrical testing and for small circuits where accuracy is paramount. The back light for the screen is a big deal; great feature. This is my second fluke115. Long story made short; the first one was stolen. If I don't lose this one, I expect it will serve me well and be passed down to a future generation. I wish I had one when I was 16, learning my way around motorcycle repair...could be an excellent gift for someone with serious interest.
customer_reviews.author: Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Good meter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son at Christmas for his school training. I have used Fluke meters throughout my years in service and had no problems spending money on this meter. Meets all the basic requirements for a digital meter along with a few extra functions he will most likely not going to need. If you are going to need to measure currents over 10A you'll need to buy a current probe to hook up to the meter to extend the range that can be measured. He has used it for 6 months now with out any issues or failures and he is happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Frankm5

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your buck for a True RMS meter.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Fluke 115. I had one for about 7 years before the dog got it and chewed it up. While my old one still works, it's a little unsightly. I bought this one for the shop and left my old one at home. This meter is by far my favorite meter I have ever worked with. Easy to use, easy to read, and durable. Fuse is easy to replace (because we all know we forget where are probes are sometimes...), and is by far the best bang for your buck for a true RMS DMM.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn W.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible contrast and glare.
customer_reviews.text: This meter has two major problems. First it has terrible glare. There are two convex covers over the LCD witch both reflect lots of light sources and the reflections are offset thus doubling the problem. The other flaw is that the contrast of the LCD is very low. Unless you view the meter from certain angles the display is very difficult to see. The back-light doesn't help with this. One guy at the EEVblog took his Fluke 115 apart trying to see if he could adjust the LCD voltages. Compare the Fluke to the Uni-T.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Lee Cummins

customer_reviews.title: Okay, screen does suck.
customer_reviews.text: First the bad. Yes, the screen sucks. If you leave it on the bench, unless you're standing right over it, the screen gets washed out. The good: you're probably not buying a Fluke for a screen. So despite what the media wants you to believe, it's actually made in Singapore, not China. Hence the price difference. It is very, very (very) fast. It has a lot of important features, like capacitance and diode analysis. Overall I am very impressed. The case also has holders for the leads, so you don't need to use the rubber band.
customer_reviews.author: Voxtel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent all around multimeter
customer_reviews.text: I was looking on line at all of the options available for multimeters. Have always wanted a Fluke but was out of my price range. Although more expensive than most others of similar class, Fluke makes an excellent product that will have a long and durable service life. Perfect for around the house and my electronic projects. Package from Amazon arrived ahead of schedule and was well packed.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory H. Robertson

customer_reviews.title: A meter you can trust .
customer_reviews.text: I use a Fluke 87 at my work but I didn’t want to spend $600 for a setup at home so I did some reading and comparing and found this 115 to be exactly what I wanted for a price I was willing to pay. This is buy far better than other meters on the market . Fluke is industry standard when you are putting your life on the line testing electrical components . Why settle for less ?
customer_reviews.author: JeeperJA

customer_reviews.title: FLUKE is the STANDARD.....
customer_reviews.text: Since becoming an Electronics/Computer Service Technician (and DIY home electrician) more than 25 years ago I've always known the outstanding quality, constant accuracy and unmatched durability of FLUKE. I've owned a less than stellar DMV that finally gave up the ghost in the middle of an electrical project at my home. I was afforded the opportunity to purchase and excited to receive my new FLUKE 115. Excellent product that performs exactly as advertised. I look forward to many years of service from my new FLUKE 115. I HIGHLY recommend this product to my colleagues, friends, neighbors and YOU!!
customer_reviews.author: TROY M.

customer_reviews.title: Replacing my 30 year old “borrowed” Fluke
customer_reviews.text: It’s a fluke so there’s not much else to say. I’ve used these for years and the only thing that they can’t do is survive being run over. Someone “borrowed” my old one so now I get a new one Years ago we joked that they had a 30-30 warrant, dropped 30 feet and then submerged in30 feet.of water. I’ve never seen one wear out.
customer_reviews.author: James W Hepler

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Meeter at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I have several Fluke meters and this is my go to. Working on medical equipment this is the meter I tend to carry with me from site to site. While it doesn’t have all the bells and whistles of my 179 or 80 series Fluke it offers everything I need and then some and I find it to be just as accurate as my more expensive Fluke meters and just as durable. I did get an$10 case to go with it and i highly recommend it if you are on the road a lot. Amazon offers several hard case options.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Gaw

customer_reviews.title: I expect more from Fluke
customer_reviews.text: I have two main issues with this meter. The first is that it doesn't really measure mA. I guess, technically, that is on me... I should have taken a closer look at the images. The second, main issue, is that there is no way to zero the meter. Even a cheap $15 meter from a hardware store has zeroing capability.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: It is nice to have a Fluke again
customer_reviews.text: About 18 years ago my Fluke DVM and Scope meter were stolen from our Shop. Since then I have been using cheap $30-40 meters. My last el-cheap-o meter died. So this time I ordered the 115 and I must say it is nice to have a good quality unit again. Paid a few $ more by buying from Fluke and not some unauthorized seller, its a better way to go in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Breakerbroke23

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable readings.
customer_reviews.text: Due to loose connections between meter and test leads, meter would give inaccurate readings on DC circuits and ohm readings. I returned and replaces with Fluke 87-V . Later learned the 115 is manufactured in China, Figures.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Ansel

customer_reviews.title: I really want to like this multimeter-- but the viewing angle for the display ...
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this multimeter-- but the viewing angle for the display is just unacceptable. When viewing straight on the text is dim, the device must be tilted back for the LCD to reach full clarity (regardless of whether back-light is on or not). I found this to be a constant annoyance from the very first power-on. If you can look past that it is a fine device, the build quality feels very rugged. Unfortunately mine is going back for a return.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Solid, repeatable
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased about 6 of these for my lab and for my clients. After various cheaper meters I really appreciate the solid, repeatable measurements year after year from this meter. If you shop you can find this meter for one twenty five or so which is a bargain for a Fluke. Several of the meters have been used in outdoor field work and still look and work like new. I recommend Pomona 5953A probes, especially for PCB work.
customer_reviews.author: H. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: very nice inexpensive basic meter
customer_reviews.text: This is a very,very nice inexpensive basic meter.It has all your basics functions for anyone learning or is looking for just a basic meter.It does come with your basic test leads, holster and a manual,but no padded case.A nice size not large or small,but ideal and for the price and next day delivery you can,t get any better than that .a A+++++++++++ and a thumbs up for this meter.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Was familiar with Fluke handheld DMM's from work. Now that I'm retired, I needed one for some of my projects. This 115 model did everything I needed without breaking the bank. I know how dependable and long lasting ours were at work, so I expect the same from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle J. Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: As an avid "do it yourselfer" I've used the basic functions of a volt meter for years. Recently my old analog meter bit the dust and my purchase of a low cost digital multimeter ended up being money wasted. Time spent with two friends exposed me to the Fluke brand. They simply work when needed (reliable) and are accurate (that's their purpose). An ingnition circuit issue in my current boat restoration project called for accurate measurements so the proper configuration of ballast resistor and coil could be used. Amazon made finding and buying my new Fluke 115 multimeter painless. The meter worked perfectly and my boat's ignition system is now working properly. Thank you Amazon and Fluke!
customer_reviews.author: MikeinMonroe

customer_reviews.title: A Worthy Low Cost Fluke Meter
customer_reviews.text: Now that I have had a chance to use this meter for a while, I can say I feel it was an excellent purchase. I first brought the meter to work and compared the readings to one of out NIST traceable calibrated meters. The comparisons were well within the meter's specifications. The meter is intuitive to use and the display is easy to read at most angles. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: B. Breault

customer_reviews.title: The reading you get from this product is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This was my husbands purchase. He had a similar one that was stolen and wanted to replace it.he’s very happy with this one and has checked voltage on many things with it. He say s Fluke is a good company that makes great products and this one was more reasonable in price then his last one.
customer_reviews.author: barbara k

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, just a tad pricey.
customer_reviews.text: Fluke is a well known producer of industry reliable multi-meters. Purchased, knowing well enough ahead of time, that this product would fit all my needs. Recommend a trace kit for the extra types of connectors that make this multi-meter versatile enough for any job.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Display is faint but still a trusted multimeter
customer_reviews.text: The only downside to this is that if you're looking at it from an angle, the display is faint. Come on fluke! Get with the times! I've used cheaper multimeters that have better displays. Other than that, it's a trusty meter.
customer_reviews.author: Brkslee

customer_reviews.title: I'm going to forego buying the case. Original pkg works fine for storage.
customer_reviews.text: Feels and looks solid and of quality build. Made in Singapore, no complaints there. Original package opens and closes nicely so I'm just going to use it for no since I won't be using this every day any how. Looking forward to using.
customer_reviews.author: CVS Shop

customer_reviews.title: Great multimeter. Been using multimeters for over 60 years ...
customer_reviews.text: Great multimeter. Been using multimeters for over 60 years and this is one of the best. It is solidly built and well designed to hold in your hand. It would have been a bit more helpful if the dc and ac ranges could have been a bit higher (say 750 to 1000 volts ) since I restore old radios and some have slightly higher voltages than 600 but this is a very minor problem. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Blue Gator

customer_reviews.title: nothing but the best
customer_reviews.text: what can i say. its a fluke. when i got heavy into pinball machine repair, i decided it was time to scrap all the inexpensive and questionable DVMs i had laying around and get something i could trust. I went straight to Fluke and have never regretted it. the diode/transister test feature is absolutely invaluable to me. i do have to say I have run into bridge rectifiers which test fine with this meter, but short out when put under load. i would love to know if there are other meters which would do a better job catching those. but aside from that, i have many hours of use with this meter and I absolutely love it.
customer_reviews.author: dpg

customer_reviews.title: Great Meter.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted. I used Fluke meters for 25 years. They were our field kit standard meter. I also used to calibrate meters in a government calibration facility. I was amazed at the number of Flukes that passed every test year after year, never needing the first adjustment. I was sold on their quality. And, they're accurate... Recommended. I will buy again...if ever I need another multimeter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful piece of equipment.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my old Fluke of 37 years! with this one. I love the frequency and capacitance measurement capability. The auto ranging is amazing and I don't think I can break this thing. Its truly idiot proof. I hope I get the same endurance as my last. If I had to buy it again I would get the 117 only because of the auto voltage sense built in. I love this machine and recommend this 115 or 117 to anyone with electrical experience and novices. Fluke does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kelcher

customer_reviews.title: Better than my Fluke 77
customer_reviews.text: This unit contains enough functions to fill any tech's needs, frequency is handy for setting generators output, capacitance checks motor capacitors accurately, the only one better is the no contact 117, but the 115 does fine for electrical work.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis P. Micke

customer_reviews.title: Professional level tool!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a pro technician. I have half a dozen digital multimeters and amp-clamps in my toolbox, including several quite expensive one from the tool trucks. Really, they're often unreliable, especially when measuring parasitic draw. I've been familiar with Fluke products for some time, but the tool trucks don't carry them, and the cost has held me back. Now, here's a VERY reasonably priced model that does everything I need, and it's auto-ranging, and absolutely perfect at showing a steady, reliable value for every test I need to do. It works perfectly, and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate, sturdy, well built multimeter(Top of the line)
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product, am loving it! Has helped me with various automotive projects. I mean after all its fluke!! The screen i have to say is a bit hard to read at an angle but personally its not much of a problem. Sturdy well built product! Its a great addition to any shop and even for the DIYselfers.
customer_reviews.author: Luis B.

customer_reviews.title: Happy with multimeter.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace a vtvm I fried, I only use around the house and mostly need only continuity & voltage functions, so this was overkill I guess, but it looks to be well made and is easy to use. It comes with test leads, and has a nice protective holster installed on it. Should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: The best meter for the price hands down~
customer_reviews.text: I have a Fluke 87V, old school Fluke 77 and a Fluke i1010, I bought this meter so I can help tutor new techs over the phone and we are both using the same meter so nothing is lost in translation. And the price is so low for a meter that is chocked full of fetures and capabilities. Small, compact and VERY well designed. Especially for the beginner. Teaching young techs has been a passion of mine for quite some time and this meter makes it possible. As a Vet from the first Gulf War, I just wanted to say thank you to the Vets at Fluke! Keep up the awesome work!
customer_reviews.author: Sparky in Kansas City

customer_reviews.title: with the best materials and the best workmanship
customer_reviews.text: All Fluke products are top quality and this is no different. It is one of the few companies that manufacturers these tools that you can KNOW is going to make it right every time, with the best materials and the best workmanship. Every electronic technician should have one of these... if you can afford it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: but obviously the good quality you would expect from Fluke
customer_reviews.text: Havent used it much yet, but obviously the good quality you would expect from Fluke. Knocked a star off only because this is advertised as a meter for electronics use and yet doesnt have a milliamps selection. Very good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Faith and David

customer_reviews.title: Low cost, Fluke quality with most needed measurements
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for one DMM with frequency and capacitance and this does the job with traditional Fluke quality at reasonably low cost. Just the probes are not as flexible as they used to be.
customer_reviews.author: marco_mx

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, easy to read, easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Everything you would expect in a high-end meter. I would give 5 stars except for the leads. For the price I expected soft flexible leads. If shop is below 60 degrees the leads are stiff.
customer_reviews.author: M. Gering

customer_reviews.title: Fluke meters the best meters you can buy
customer_reviews.text: Fluke has been the Cadillac of multi meters for a very long time. They are rugged ans work flawlessly from checking wall sockets to help diagnosing automotive electrical problems or just checking to see if the batteries in the drawer are still good. A food multi meter is one of the most useful item for anyone who does home or auto repairs to hobbies. A Fluke meter is always money well spend and the choice of professionals.
customer_reviews.author: Scooter

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for about 4.5 years and I'm very pleased with it. I've used it for various things, such as RC hobby work, electronics and prototyping, and troubleshooting electrical issues with my car.
customer_reviews.author: chris s

customer_reviews.title: This is a great meter but get the 177 or 179 if you ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great meter but get the 177 or 179 if you can afford it. I found that the 177 and 179 are made in the US, have a much better internal build quality and has a better manufacture warranty. I'm not a professional electrician but I consider the 177 or 179 entry level for professionals or handymen on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: H. L. Chambers

customer_reviews.title: A reading you can depend on
customer_reviews.text: I have been using cheaper multimeters from hobby and building supply stores. The needles/numbers waver so much that you really can't tell what the actual reading should be. You end up taking a leap of faith for a value somewhere in between the maximum and minimum values. This meter gives you ONE value that gives you confidence and assurance that is the value. It is larger, heavier but it does the job well. I find myself using it more and it is easier to use than some cheaper alternatives. Now I have a tool that I can depend on.
customer_reviews.author: Szoo2

customer_reviews.title: Best affordable multimeter
customer_reviews.text: I have been a technician for years, and I don't trust any other meter to make accurate diagnosis. Still accurate years later, partially melted, dropped many times, never fails. Fluke makes the best doom hands down. (Pro tip get the magnetic strap so you can hang the meter it makes a world of difference.
customer_reviews.author: Willy Diesel

customer_reviews.title: Buy fluke and forget the rest
customer_reviews.text: Best meter by far been using DMM for 25 years had dozen brands or so and Fluke is always the best choice when it has to be reliable and accurate
customer_reviews.author: Maximus Car Audio

customer_reviews.title: The best multimeter in its class.
customer_reviews.text: This is a highly reliable and versatile tool that is easy to use. Highly recommended for general electrical applications. Excellent performance at good value.
customer_reviews.author: Jake.

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: the lcd is hard to read !!!!! very disappointed from fluke also it has delays on continuing buzzer!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fluke quality at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.text: This meter measures up to the Fluke reputation. Features and accuracy for the price can't be beat if you want a Fluke.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis G.

customer_reviews.title: Works great, exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Works great, exactly as described. Was a required piece of equipment for my son's toolbox to earn his degree in Agriculture diesel mechanics. He uses it on a regular basis, from moderate to heavy you, and it has held up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Mounts

customer_reviews.title: Very nice buy. Works great.
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for his electronics lab. Came quickly, competitively priced. Well made. He is extremely picky about these types of purchases and has been in electronics for about 20 years. Says hes very happy with it. Durable and handy.
customer_reviews.author: Karliepie

customer_reviews.title: worth it. designs change, but the quality seems constant
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several Fluke DMM's. This is the latest one, as the others were stolen one by one. Loss replacement is the only reason I am not using the first one I bought in 1978. They have all performed exceptionally well. The designs change, but the quality seems constant.
customer_reviews.author: WM173

customer_reviews.title: Not a fluke.  Well, it is, but you know what I mean.
customer_reviews.text: Oh, it's only electricity, so close enough is fine. Ummm, not for me. This instrument follows the line of Fluke products and that means it is great. Repeatability says much about a measuring device and this has a nice consistent nature. It is well sized, the leads are great, the case is pro, and you need to be good to yourself and get this. Please check all circuits before you touch. Shutting off the breaker is not enough.
customer_reviews.author: susie q

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves this!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my husband. He was very happy with this and said it worked great! He has purchased cheaper ones in the past but said that this one was better by leaps and bounds. So far, we have not had any issues with this.
customer_reviews.author: Candies32

customer_reviews.title: Nice multimeter for pros.
customer_reviews.text: A professional meter for electrical measurements. I have had many meters, but none as well made as this one. Big display makes reading it easier.
customer_reviews.author: removeb4flight

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I started out with a cheap $40 Ideal DMM that the battery holder stopped working correctly on and eventually the whole thing stopped working after using it about 4 times. Finally decided to get a good quality multimeter. I repair circuit cards and electronics at work where our DMMs are Fluke almost exclusively. This model had the best features for my home budget and has worked flawlessly so far. Good construction, nice backlight, fairly compact, durable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio

customer_reviews.title: Handy Meter
customer_reviews.text: This is a good little meter. The capacitance function is helpful for checking out motor capacitors etc. It also checks diodes by showing the junction voltage. The voltage input is limited to 600V to ground - probably not intended to be used on 480V RMS. It has a button to light the display, which is handy in dark places.
customer_reviews.author: Rurik Osipich

customer_reviews.title: This is my go to meter
customer_reviews.text: Love this meter. It's rugged and can take a beating. Not too mention very accurate and easy to use. I recommend this as your go to meter in most situations.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent A.

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck in a quality instrument.
customer_reviews.text: Nice meter for the price. Bought it for the frequency function to test car electronics. Works perfect for that. Tested all the functions the meter provides and everything seems to be working as expected.
customer_reviews.author: John KaBang

customer_reviews.title: NO HOLSTER
customer_reviews.text: seems like a good meter, quite a bit heavy than my other two meters if thats any sign of quailty but than it cost more than both of them and then some. It did not come with a holster as claimed.Was not planning on using it anyway but still there it is.my 3320 innova reads the exactly the same voltage of the fluke but i noticed that the Fluke settles down alot quicker.I guess time will tell how good this meter . so far so good
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is a Fluke!
customer_reviews.text: High quality as expected from Fluke. You get what you pay for with this company
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Great metera
customer_reviews.text: About $50 cheaper on Amazon-well worth it. Make sure you purchase a case for it!
customer_reviews.author: Pierre

customer_reviews.title: Compact easy to use meter
customer_reviews.text: First of all let me say I expected nothing but the best after all it is a Fluke. I got this meter as a back up it is small and suits my needs I am very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Hayden Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Love the meter. Cant go without it.
customer_reviews.text: Best meter I ever had. When I lose this one I will buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Some scales very sensetive to blowout
customer_reviews.text: The mV and amp scales are easily burned out if you over load them by very much and sooner or later this is very likely to happen with anyone who uses their meter a lot, especially if they are in a hurry. This is true with most multimeters but I do believe that it is possible to protect these meters even on these blowout prone scales with the right circuitry. Other than that this is an excellent meter.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Boulais

customer_reviews.title: Awesome multimeter
customer_reviews.text: For the price this guy is great. I bought the automotive expansion lead kit and it makes this guy some much better. Only wish is that it had mA but they don't in this model. I'd have to pay more for the step up to another multimeter model but that's ok! This guy does it's job and has a handy back light and stand.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line tool
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Everything is very straight forward and easy to figure out .
customer_reviews.author: Clintlgm

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with its performance and quality
customer_reviews.text: This meter is used by me for automotive and equipment electrical work. I am very happy with its performance and quality. I can trust the readings in all settings. I figured it was time to step up to a Fluke. The price through Amazon was very reasonable. I would recommend this meter to anyone looking for a real professional high quality tool.
customer_reviews.author: Boojie2000

customer_reviews.title: Best meter ever!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read and fast. You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: eVictor54

customer_reviews.title: Very nice meter for not too much money...
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price, this meter does most of what one needs for basic electrical measurements. Compared to more expensive Flukes, accuracy is about the same, just fewer features. Compared to cheaper meters, I don't know - Fluke has never let me down and I will continue to buy their products. These lower price meters from Fluke are just as durable and usable as the high-end Flukes. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Peter A. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I love this meter
customer_reviews.text: This was about the the tenth meter I have bought in the past 40 years. I am proud to say that although it was the most expensive it is the best made and a high quaility meter. Easy to use and read display. I am a do it yourselfer and use a meter frenquently to measure voltages AC and DC, and check ohlms. I would recommend this meter to anyone who is serious about their equipment and work. Fluke has several models depending on your need and this is a great basic model.
customer_reviews.author: Big Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great Multimeter
customer_reviews.text: Owned one for a couple years - just bought one for my son.
customer_reviews.author: RPM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me...
customer_reviews.text: Just an occasional meter user - around the house, around the boat. After years messing with less expensive brands crapping out in various ways, I ponied up and got this Fluke a couple months ago. Money well spent - Great feel, sturdy, dependable steady display - Really, a pleasure to use. And from all the other reviews read here, which led to this purchase, I'm looking forward to years of reliability.
customer_reviews.author: BD

customer_reviews.title: What can I say, nothing beata a Fluke for the money, and its very durrable.
customer_reviews.text: What can I say, nothing beata a Fluke for the money, and its very durrable.
customer_reviews.author: Guzman-Escobar

customer_reviews.title: Fluke multimeter
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good multimeter. Well legible with large numbers. it comes with a good set of testing wires. I always like Fluke instruments. They are generally well built> I recommend this meter
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Glad I finally moved up a to professional quality instrument!
customer_reviews.text: I have had a lot of multimeters, which I use in my boat repair business, but this is the first professional quality one. I particularly like the longer test leads, the louder buzz when using the continuity function, the AC cycles function. The unit is solid, the dial positive, the functions layout logical. The back light and min-max function very useful. I'm glad I spent the extra money. I hope it lasts a while.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Steve

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC METER
customer_reviews.text: A really valuable meter. Works great and easy to use. Fluke makes great meters and this one lives up to their name.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis G.

customer_reviews.title: A REAL meter
customer_reviews.text: Very sensitive, I use fluke at work and this is my first REAL meter for home. Can't go wrong with fluke
customer_reviews.author: RR

customer_reviews.title: Screen Display is so bad and cheap
customer_reviews.text: The display has to be viewed from one exact angle to be readable. Other than that this is a great instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Atle S.

customer_reviews.title: Really good meter
customer_reviews.text: Bought a craftsman multi-meter for around the house. Used it trying to troubleshoot my motorcycle stator, but the readings were jumping all over the place - sometimes giving me different readings on the same wire. I was fed up with it and tossed it. Got the Fluke 115 and accurate readings all the time. This Fluke probably wont see much action like my work meter, but when I need it it wont give me flimsy answers!
customer_reviews.author: VW808

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with Fluke
customer_reviews.text: I had originally picked up the Extech 420 but it didn't ready capacitance as high as I needed it to. It was also an averaging DMM so that also wasn't going to work. For a little extra cash I was able to pick up this Fluke 115 that exceeds the Extechs capabilities. I feels solid and is easy to operate. I do wish they came with the protection bag, I hate putting it in my work bag with the screen exposed to other tools. For that I would take half a star off. Other than that I love it.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Its a Fluke!
customer_reviews.text: It's a Fluke! That's all you need to know :) The only kind I trust not to blow up on me if I accidentally forget to switch from Ohm check to volt or amp check while testing a circuit.
customer_reviews.author: hyperstatic

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend works for the navy and loves this tho g he even sent it off to be tested and approved to use on the federal ships
customer_reviews.author: summer

customer_reviews.title: Decent meter with some small issues
customer_reviews.text: I've used Fluke meters at work for quite a while. This one works just like the older ones in that it gets quick readings but the biggest issue I've seen is the display. It works, but it has a viewing angle problem where the digits are not perfectly clear looking straight on like one would expect. Instead on needs to look at an angle to get decent contrast with the LCD display. Not too big of a deal but it's the largest weakness I've seen with it.
customer_reviews.author: NexunFromGalaxy

customer_reviews.title: Tough to use without test leads.
customer_reviews.text: The product description stated a test lead set was included “in the box”. The test leads are clearly missing! Why would anyone sell something so expensive without the basic cables?
customer_reviews.author: Travelin Man

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Fluke’s reputation proceeds them. If you don’t have accurate information when trouble shooting electrical problems (automotive in my case), you can’t make valid conclusions.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Best all around meter.
customer_reviews.text: Best volt / amp / freq counter / capacitance meter. I have ever seen. I own two, one for the house and one for the shop.
customer_reviews.author: TOM

customer_reviews.title: Accurate, reliable, Fluke reputation precedes it
customer_reviews.text: I got this after I got tired of cheaper multimeters dying on me. I decided to bite the bullet and get the best and Fluke has that reputation. Fits my hand very well, able to move the selector dial with one hand and sturdy. Construction seems very well made. Long term I hope it holds up to the Fluke reputation but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: B. LEW

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: i needed this for more accuracy and its great. feels like a tank , well made. love the back light
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice meter with protective cover for the price
customer_reviews.text: Nice meter with protective cover for the price. The main reason I bought this model 115 was it is a True RMS meter for more accurate readings and because it is a Fluke. I've used various Fluke meters over the last 40+ years where I work. This one I'll use at home with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: A must have for DIY-ers
customer_reviews.text: Every DIY-er should have a multimeter in their toolbox, and the Fluke 115 is without a doubt worth every penny. I use these at work maintaining aircraft and when I'm at home doing work on my car, computer, remodeling, etc. The large backlit display means you can easily see measurements regardless of where you're working or what you're working on. The overall construction is solid, and I've personally seen these meters take a ton of abuse without breaking. Believe me, with any Fluke product you're not paying for the name - you're making a solid investment in equipment that will last for years without fail.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Kaster

customer_reviews.title: Another good Fluke meter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this meter primarily for it's voltage min/max recording ability and price. It was an addition to my suite of true RMS Fluke electrical test meters. Having used it, I wish I had bought instead the one in the series (117) that has a low impedance voltage test ability. I don't always want the high impedance voltage feature as "phantom readings" are often a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Phillips

product_meta.title: Fluke 115 Compact True-RMS Digital Multimeter
product_meta.description:
Style:StandardThe Fluke 115 Field Service True-RMS Technicians Multimeter is a compact meter for field service technicians and it is also the solution for a wide variety of electrical and electronic testing applications. It includes a 4mm silicone test lead set, a user manual and an installed 9V battery. The Fluke 115 displays true-rms voltage and current readings with 6000 count resolution, test diodes frequency, continuity and capacitance and provides Min/Max/Average readings to record signal fluctuations. A large white LED backlight aids work in poorly lit areas. Its easy-open battery access door makes battery changes a snap. It has been independently tested for safe use in CAT III 600 Volt environments Fluke Corporation is the world leader in the manufacture, distribution and service of electronic test tools and software. Since its founding in 1948, Fluke has helped define and grow a unique technology market, providing testing and troubleshooting capabilities that have grown to mission critical status in manufacturing and service industries. From industrial electronic installation, maintenance and service, to precision measurement and quality control, Fluke tools help keep business and industry around the globe up and running.

AMAZON.COM
Rugged and accurate enough for professional use, the Fluke 115 Multimeter for Field Service Technicians is ideal for a wide variety of electrical and electronic testing applications. Offering Min/Max/Average measurements with elapsed time to record signal fluctuations, this True-RMS meter provides easy one-handed operation in a compact package. For added convenience, it arrives ready to go with TL75 test leads, holster, and nine-volt battery.



Portable True-RMS Meter for Readings On the Go
Lightweight and compact, the Fluke 115 is easy to handle, making it the perfect choice for measuring components, voltages, and circuits on the go. Accurate, easy-to-use, and comfortable to carry in the palm of your hand, this multimeter does it all. Use it on the jobsite or around the house--wherever and whenever you need a general purpose, portable meter that gives clear, accurate readings.Compatible with ToolPak, a convenient magnetic holder (sold separately), the Fluke 115 will give you even greater on-the-job portability.

Simple, Intuitive Operation Ensures Accuracy
Complete with a backlit 6,000-count digital display that features large digits for easy reading, the Fluke 115 is exceptionally user friendly. Its straightforward labeling clearly shows the function of each button, dial, and jack. And best of all, this True RMS meter gives you easy-to-understand readings. For example, a simple beep indicates when a wire or fuse is functioning properly--no beep means it's time to recheck your settings.

For further convenience, the Fluke 115 offers auto ranging, and it guards against common errors that could lead to inaccurate readings. For example, if you forget to turn the dial to 'A', and then feed current into the meter, or if you switch the dial to 'A', but forget to switch the lead to amps, this meter will alert you to the problem.

Professional Meter That's Versatile, Safe, and Accurate
Offering a DC ma range that can handle everything from 200ma to 1A, the Fluke 115 allows you to check continuity, frequency, capacitance, and diode test. It measures 20 A (30 seconds momentary, 10 A continuous) and even provides accurate measurements on non-linear loads.

Additionally, its operating temperature range of -10 degrees to +60 degrees Celsius combines with durable casing for maximum resistance to wear and tear. An added bonus, overload protection ensures uninterrupted operation and long life.

CAT III 600-volt safety rated, the Fluke 115 is UL, CSA, TUV, and VDE listed, and all of its inputs are protected to CE, IEN61010-1 CAT III 600V.

What's in the Box
Multimeter; holster; nine-volt battery (installed); 4mm silicone test lead set; and user manual.






FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The FLU115 is the solution for a wide variety of electrical and electronic testing applications. Features Minimum /Maximum /Average with elapsed time to record signal fluctuations. This True-RMS meter provides easy one-handed operation in a compact package. Includes TL75 Test leads, holster, user's manual and 9-volt battery (installed).

See more
